name: ADDRESSES_PROVIDER
description: Returns the PoolAddressesProvider connected to this contract

name: BRIDGE_PROTOCOL_FEE
description: Returns the part of the bridge fees sent to protocol

name: FLASHLOAN_PREMIUM_TOTAL
description: Returns the total fee on flash loans

name: FLASHLOAN_PREMIUM_TO_PROTOCOL
description: Returns the part of the flashloan fees sent to protocol

name: MAX_NUMBER_RESERVES
description: Returns the maximum number of reserves supported to be listed in this Pool

name: MAX_STABLE_RATE_BORROW_SIZE_PERCENT
description: Returns the percentage of available liquidity that can be borrowed at once at stable rate

name: POOL_REVISION
description: Description for POOL_REVISION

name: backUnbacked
description: Back the current unbacked underlying with `amount` and pay `fee`.

asset.description: The address of the underlying asset to back

name: borrow
description: Allows users to borrow a specific `amount` of the reserve underlying asset, provided that the borrower already supplied enough collateral, or he was given enough allowance by a credit delegator on the corresponding debt token (StableDebtToken or VariableDebtToken) - E.g. User borrows 100 USDC passing as `onBehalfOf` his own address, receiving the 100 USDC in his wallet   and 100 stable/variable debt tokens, depending on the `interestRateMode`

asset.description: The address of the underlying asset to borrow

interestRateMode.description: The interest rate mode at which the user wants to borrow: 1 for Stable, 2 for Variable

referralCode.description: The code used to register the integrator originating the operation, for potential rewards.   0 if the action is executed directly by the user, without any middle-man

onBehalfOf.description: The address of the user who will receive the debt. Should be the address of the borrower itself calling the function if he wants to borrow against his own collateral, or the address of the credit delegator if he has been given credit delegation allowance

name: configureEModeCategory
description: Configures a new category for the eMode.. In eMode, the protocol allows very high borrowing power to borrow assets of the same category. The category 0 is reserved as it's the default for volatile assets

name: deposit
description: Supplies an `amount` of underlying asset into the reserve, receiving in return overlying aTokens. - E.g. User supplies 100 USDC and gets in return 100 aUSDC. Deprecated: maintained for compatibility purposes

asset.description: The address of the underlying asset to supply

onBehalfOf.description: The address that will receive the aTokens, same as msg.sender if the user   wants to receive them on his own wallet, or a different address if the beneficiary of aTokens   is a different wallet

referralCode.description: Code used to register the integrator originating the operation, for potential rewards.   0 if the action is executed directly by the user, without any middle-man

name: dropReserve
description: Drop a reserve. Only callable by the PoolConfigurator contract

asset.description: The address of the underlying asset of the reserve

name: finalizeTransfer
description: Validates and finalizes an aToken transfer. Only callable by the overlying aToken of the `asset`

asset.description: The address of the underlying asset of the aToken

from.description: The user from which the aTokens are transferred

balanceFromBefore.description: The aToken balance of the `from` user before the transfer

balanceToBefore.description: The aToken balance of the `to` user before the transfer

name: flashLoan
description: Allows smartcontracts to access the liquidity of the pool within one transaction, as long as the amount taken plus a fee is returned.. IMPORTANT There are security concerns for developers of flashloan receiver contracts that must be kept into consideration. For further details please visit https://docs.aave.com/developers/

receiverAddress.description: The address of the contract receiving the funds, implementing IFlashLoanReceiver interface

assets.description: The addresses of the assets being flash-borrowed

amounts.description: The amounts of the assets being flash-borrowed

interestRateModes.description: Types of the debt to open if the flash loan is not returned:   0 -> Don't open any debt, just revert if funds can't be transferred from the receiver   1 -> Open debt at stable rate for the value of the amount flash-borrowed to the `onBehalfOf` address   2 -> Open debt at variable rate for the value of the amount flash-borrowed to the `onBehalfOf` address

onBehalfOf.description: The address  that will receive the debt in the case of using on `modes` 1 or 2

params.description: Variadic packed params to pass to the receiver as extra information

referralCode.description: The code used to register the integrator originating the operation, for potential rewards.   0 if the action is executed directly by the user, without any middle-man

name: flashLoanSimple
description: Allows smartcontracts to access the liquidity of the pool within one transaction, as long as the amount taken plus a fee is returned.. IMPORTANT There are security concerns for developers of flashloan receiver contracts that must be kept into consideration. For further details please visit https://docs.aave.com/developers/

receiverAddress.description: The address of the contract receiving the funds, implementing IFlashLoanSimpleReceiver interface

asset.description: The address of the asset being flash-borrowed

amount.description: The amount of the asset being flash-borrowed

params.description: Variadic packed params to pass to the receiver as extra information

referralCode.description: The code used to register the integrator originating the operation, for potential rewards.   0 if the action is executed directly by the user, without any middle-man

name: getConfiguration
description: Returns the configuration of the reserve

asset.description: The address of the underlying asset of the reserve

name: getEModeCategoryData
description: Returns the data of an eMode category

name: getReserveAddressById
description: Returns the address of the underlying asset of a reserve by the reserve id as stored in the DataTypes.ReserveData struct

id.description: The id of the reserve as stored in the DataTypes.ReserveData struct

name: getReserveData
description: Returns the state and configuration of the reserve

asset.description: The address of the underlying asset of the reserve

name: getReserveNormalizedIncome
description: Returns the normalized income of the reserve

asset.description: The address of the underlying asset of the reserve

name: getReserveNormalizedVariableDebt
description: Returns the normalized variable debt per unit of asset. WARNING: This function is intended to be used primarily by the protocol itself to get a "dynamic" variable index based on time, current stored index and virtual rate at the current moment (approx. a borrower would get if opening a position). This means that is always used in combination with variable debt supply/balances. If using this function externally, consider that is possible to have an increasing normalized variable debt that is not equivalent to how the variable debt index would be updated in storage (e.g. only updates with non-zero variable debt supply)

asset.description: The address of the underlying asset of the reserve

name: getReservesList
description: Returns the list of the underlying assets of all the initialized reserves. It does not include dropped reserves

name: getUserAccountData
description: Returns the user account data across all the reserves

name: getUserConfiguration
description: Returns the configuration of the user across all the reserves

name: getUserEMode
description: Returns the eMode the user is using

name: initReserve
description: Initializes a reserve, activating it, assigning an aToken and debt tokens and an interest rate strategy. Only callable by the PoolConfigurator contract

asset.description: The address of the underlying asset of the reserve

aTokenAddress.description: The address of the aToken that will be assigned to the reserve

stableDebtAddress.description: The address of the StableDebtToken that will be assigned to the reserve

variableDebtAddress.description: The address of the VariableDebtToken that will be assigned to the reserve

interestRateStrategyAddress.description: The address of the interest rate strategy contract

name: initialize
description: Initializes the Pool.. Function is invoked by the proxy contract when the Pool contract is added to the PoolAddressesProvider of the market.Caching the address of the PoolAddressesProvider in order to reduce gas consumption on subsequent operations

name: liquidationCall
description: Function to liquidate a non-healthy position collateral-wise, with Health Factor below 1 - The caller (liquidator) covers `debtToCover` amount of debt of the user getting liquidated, and receives   a proportionally amount of the `collateralAsset` plus a bonus to cover market risk

collateralAsset.description: The address of the underlying asset used as collateral, to receive as result of the liquidation

debtAsset.description: The address of the underlying borrowed asset to be repaid with the liquidation

user.description: The address of the borrower getting liquidated

debtToCover.description: The debt amount of borrowed `asset` the liquidator wants to cover

receiveAToken.description: True if the liquidators wants to receive the collateral aTokens, `false` if he wants to receive the underlying collateral asset directly

name: mintToTreasury
description: Mints the assets accrued through the reserve factor to the treasury in the form of aTokens

assets.description: The list of reserves for which the minting needs to be executed

name: mintUnbacked
description: Mints an `amount` of aTokens to the `onBehalfOf`

asset.description: The address of the underlying asset to mint

onBehalfOf.description: The address that will receive the aTokens

referralCode.description: Code used to register the integrator originating the operation, for potential rewards.   0 if the action is executed directly by the user, without any middle-man

name: rebalanceStableBorrowRate
description: Rebalances the stable interest rate of a user to the current stable rate defined on the reserve. - Users can be rebalanced if the following conditions are satisfied:     1. Usage ratio is above 95%     2. the current supply APY is below REBALANCE_UP_THRESHOLD * maxVariableBorrowRate, which means that too        much has been borrowed at a stable rate and suppliers are not earning enough

asset.description: The address of the underlying asset borrowed

user.description: The address of the user to be rebalanced

name: repay
description: Repays a borrowed `amount` on a specific reserve, burning the equivalent debt tokens owned - E.g. User repays 100 USDC, burning 100 variable/stable debt tokens of the `onBehalfOf` address

asset.description: The address of the borrowed underlying asset previously borrowed

amount.description: The amount to repay - Send the value type(uint256).max in order to repay the whole debt for `asset` on the specific `debtMode`

interestRateMode.description: The interest rate mode at of the debt the user wants to repay: 1 for Stable, 2 for Variable

onBehalfOf.description: The address of the user who will get his debt reduced/removed. Should be the address of the user calling the function if he wants to reduce/remove his own debt, or the address of any other other borrower whose debt should be removed

name: repayWithATokens
description: Repays a borrowed `amount` on a specific reserve using the reserve aTokens, burning the equivalent debt tokens - E.g. User repays 100 USDC using 100 aUSDC, burning 100 variable/stable debt tokens. Passing uint256.max as amount will clean up any residual aToken dust balance, if the user aToken balance is not enough to cover the whole debt

asset.description: The address of the borrowed underlying asset previously borrowed

amount.description: The amount to repay - Send the value type(uint256).max in order to repay the whole debt for `asset` on the specific `debtMode`

interestRateMode.description: The interest rate mode at of the debt the user wants to repay: 1 for Stable, 2 for Variable

name: repayWithPermit
description: Repay with transfer approval of asset to be repaid done via permit function see: https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-2612 and https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-713

asset.description: The address of the borrowed underlying asset previously borrowed

amount.description: The amount to repay - Send the value type(uint256).max in order to repay the whole debt for `asset` on the specific `debtMode`

interestRateMode.description: The interest rate mode at of the debt the user wants to repay: 1 for Stable, 2 for Variable

onBehalfOf.description: Address of the user who will get his debt reduced/removed. Should be the address of the user calling the function if he wants to reduce/remove his own debt, or the address of any other other borrower whose debt should be removed

deadline.description: The deadline timestamp that the permit is valid

permitV.description: The V parameter of ERC712 permit sig

permitR.description: The R parameter of ERC712 permit sig

permitS.description: The S parameter of ERC712 permit sig

name: rescueTokens
description: Rescue and transfer tokens locked in this contract

amount.description: The amount of token to transfer

name: resetIsolationModeTotalDebt
description: Resets the isolation mode total debt of the given asset to zero. It requires the given asset has zero debt ceiling

asset.description: The address of the underlying asset to reset the isolationModeTotalDebt

name: setConfiguration
description: Sets the configuration bitmap of the reserve as a whole. Only callable by the PoolConfigurator contract

asset.description: The address of the underlying asset of the reserve

name: setReserveInterestRateStrategyAddress
description: Updates the address of the interest rate strategy contract. Only callable by the PoolConfigurator contract

asset.description: The address of the underlying asset of the reserve

rateStrategyAddress.description: The address of the interest rate strategy contract

name: setUserEMode
description: Allows a user to use the protocol in eMode

name: setUserUseReserveAsCollateral
description: Allows suppliers to enable/disable a specific supplied asset as collateral

asset.description: The address of the underlying asset supplied

useAsCollateral.description: True if the user wants to use the supply as collateral, false otherwise

name: supply
description: Supplies an `amount` of underlying asset into the reserve, receiving in return overlying aTokens. - E.g. User supplies 100 USDC and gets in return 100 aUSDC

asset.description: The address of the underlying asset to supply

onBehalfOf.description: The address that will receive the aTokens, same as msg.sender if the user   wants to receive them on his own wallet, or a different address if the beneficiary of aTokens   is a different wallet

referralCode.description: Code used to register the integrator originating the operation, for potential rewards.   0 if the action is executed directly by the user, without any middle-man

name: supplyWithPermit
description: Supply with transfer approval of asset to be supplied done via permit function see: https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-2612 and https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-713

asset.description: The address of the underlying asset to supply

onBehalfOf.description: The address that will receive the aTokens, same as msg.sender if the user   wants to receive them on his own wallet, or a different address if the beneficiary of aTokens   is a different wallet

referralCode.description: Code used to register the integrator originating the operation, for potential rewards.   0 if the action is executed directly by the user, without any middle-man

deadline.description: The deadline timestamp that the permit is valid

permitV.description: The V parameter of ERC712 permit sig

permitR.description: The R parameter of ERC712 permit sig

permitS.description: The S parameter of ERC712 permit sig

name: swapBorrowRateMode
description: Allows a borrower to swap his debt between stable and variable mode, or vice versa

asset.description: The address of the underlying asset borrowed

interestRateMode.description: The current interest rate mode of the position being swapped: 1 for Stable, 2 for Variable

name: updateBridgeProtocolFee
description: Updates the protocol fee on the bridging

name: updateFlashloanPremiums
description: Updates flash loan premiums. Flash loan premium consists of two parts: - A part is sent to aToken holders as extra, one time accumulated interest - A part is collected by the protocol treasury. The total premium is calculated on the total borrowed amountThe premium to protocol is calculated on the total premium, being a percentage of `flashLoanPremiumTotal`Only callable by the PoolConfigurator contract

flashLoanPremiumTotal.description: The total premium, expressed in bps

flashLoanPremiumToProtocol.description: The part of the premium sent to the protocol treasury, expressed in bps

name: withdraw
description: Withdraws an `amount` of underlying asset from the reserve, burning the equivalent aTokens owned E.g. User has 100 aUSDC, calls withdraw() and receives 100 USDC, burning the 100 aUSDC

asset.description: The address of the underlying asset to withdraw

amount.description: The underlying amount to be withdrawn   - Send the value type(uint256).max in order to withdraw the whole aToken balance

to.description: The address that will receive the underlying, same as msg.sender if the user   wants to receive it on his own wallet, or a different address if the beneficiary is a   different wallet
